newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft's Gates sees Latam, Far East growth.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft's Gates sees Latam, Far East growth.

text.p: Microsoft Corp chairman and chief executive officer Bill Gates said Tuesday he saw "very high growth" for the company in the Far East and Latin America.

"I'd say that the Far East and Latin America are the two very high growth areas for Microsoft, and I'm not sure which one will be higher growth," Gates told reporters during a Microsoft conference with Latin American business leaders.
"I'm very excited about what's going on throughout the region" of Latin America, he added. "We see it as a top growth region for us."
Among the company's plans were the introduction of WebTV into Latin America, Gates told a news conference.

Microsoft Corp said in April that it had agreed to acquire privately held WebTV Networks for cash and stock valued at about $425 million in a move aimed at bringing the personal computer and the television closer together.
"Some time this year we'll come up with a plan to put Web TV in Latin America," he said, adding that the company was considering which partners to link up with in that venture.
Gates said he had met Costa Rican president Jose Maria Figueres Monday in Miami and discussed projects in which Microsoft might work with the government of the Central American nation.
"Nothing concrete" had been agreed, though, he said.
Asked what he expected from a high-technology "summit" he has called of more than 100 of the world's top corporate chief executives in Seattle this week, Gates said:
"It's part of our regular ongoing dialogue with business leaders, and there's people from around the world including Latin America who are joining in to that."
"Vice President Al Gore is one of the attendees, it's a good group."
The CEOs would be "talking about how the new competitive environment is both a challenge and and opportunity for businesses of all kinds," he added.
